  1. from django.db import models
  2. from countries.models import Country
  6. class Person(models.Model):
  7. """
  8. Represents a person, such as John Doe, Joe Public, or Jiminy Cricket.
  9. """
  11. GENDER_CHOICES = (
  12. (u'M', u'Male'),
  13. (u'F', u'Female'),
  14. )
  15. gender = models.CharField(max_length=1, choices=GENDER_CHOICES)
  17. TITLE_CHOICES = (
  18. (u'DR', u'Dr.'),
  19. (u'MR', u'Mr.'),
  20. (u'MS', u'Ms.'),
  21. (u'MRS', u'Mrs.'),
  22. (u'SIR', u'Sir'),
  23. (u'LORD', u'Lord'),
  24. )
  25. title = models.CharField(max_length=10, choices=TITLE_CHOICES)
  27. first_name = models.CharField(max_length=255)
  28. last_name = models.CharField(max_length=255)
  29. other_names = models.CharField(max_length=255, blank=True, help_text="Middle names, comma separated")
  30. date_of_birth = models.DateField(null=True, blank=True)
  31. date_of_death = models.DateField(null=True, blank=True)
  32. profile = models.TextField(blank=True, help_text="Description of Person")
  33. is_deceased = models.BooleanField(default=False)
  34. nationality = models.ManyToManyField(Country, blank=True, null=True, related_name="nationalities")
  36. # Cached Data
  37. full_name = models.CharField(max_length=255, blank=True, editable=False)
  38. date_modified = models.DateTimeField(null=True, blank=True, editable=False, auto_now=True)
  39. date_created = models.DateTimeField(null=True, blank=True, editable=False, auto_now_add=True)
  41. class Meta:
  42. verbose_name_plural = 'People'
  43. verbose_name = 'Person'
  44. ordering = ['last_name', 'first_name', 'date_of_birth']
  46. def __unicode__(self):
  47. return u'%s' % (unicode(self.full_name))
  49. def age(self):
  50. from datetime import date
  51. if self.date_of_birth != None:
  52. today = date.today()
  53. dob = self.date_of_birth
  54. if (today.month > dob.month) and (today.day > dob.day):
  55. return (today.year - dob.year)
  56. else:
  57. return ((today.year - dob.year) -1)
  58. else:
  59. return None
  61. def name(self):
  62. """
  63. Return the person's name. If we have special titles, use them, otherwise,
  64. don't include the title.
  65. """
  67. if self.title == "DR" or self.title == "SIR" or self.title == "LORD":
  68. return str(self.get_title_display()) + " " + str(self.first_name) + " " + str(self.last_name)
  69. else:
  70. return str(self.first_name) + " " + str(self.last_name)
  72. def get_absolute_url(self):
  73. return ('person_profile', (), { 'person_id': self.id})
  74. get_absolute_url = models.permalink(get_absolute_url)
  79. def save(self, *args, **kwargs):
  80. """
  81. If date of death is specified, set is_deceased to true
  82. """
  83. if self.date_of_death != None:
  84. self.is_deceased = True
  86. # Since we often copy and paste from strange sources, do some basic cleanup
  87. self.first_name = self.first_name.strip()
  88. self.last_name = self.last_name.strip()
  89. self.other_names = self.other_names.strip()
  90. self.full_name = str(self.name())
  91. self.profile = self.profile.encode('ascii', 'ignore').encode('utf8')
  94. # Call save method
  95. super(Person, self).save(*args, **kwargs) # Call the "real" save() method.
